page.title: 05HOUSING, THEBERTON
page.content: Most of the property, other than parts of Theberton is old, varying from 16th century to Victorian and mostly farmhouse or cottage. East Green has one or two houses built this century but there is a spate of new but unfinished building happening in Theberton amongst the cottages, reflecting the gradual increase in population. All domestic property has to have plans submitted and approved by the Suffolk Coastal District Authority, but the addition of farm buildings for agricultural purposes needs neither plans presented or approved resulting in some lovely farmhouses bing dwarfed and surrounded by gross grain stores, huge barns and store buildings, in some cases several times the size of the farmhouse. There are 4 large houses in the area dating from the turn of the century.
